bug.summary: RandomResizedCrop gives same relative scale across batch samples
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: transform = K.RandomResizedCrop(size=(224, 224), same_on_batch=False, return_transform=True) sample = torch.randn(4, 3, 256, 256) out, trans = transform(sample) print(trans) output: <denchmark-code>tensor([[[ 1.2120e+00, 0.0000e+00, -4.4842e+01], [-1.0788e-09, 1.0773e+00, -3.2319e+00], [-9.2969e-11, -9.8340e-19, 1.0000e+00]],
[[ 1.2120e+00, 0.0000e+00, -6.6658e+01], [ 7.9805e-09, 1.0773e+00, -3.0164e+01], [-9.2969e-11, 8.2639e-11, 1.0000e+00]],
[[ 1.2120e+00, 1.6034e-08, -7.2717e+01], [ 1.5634e-08, 1.0773e+00, -4.4169e+01], [-9.2969e-11, -3.3056e-10, 1.0000e+00]],
[[ 1.2120e+00, 0.0000e+00, -4.8478e+00], [-2.5364e-09, 1.0773e+00, -4.3092e+00], [ 4.9971e-10, -3.4089e-10, 1.0000e+00]]]) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Since I set same_on_batch=False, it should give different relative scales for different samples. However, in the corresponding items in the returned transformation matrix((0, 0), (1, 1)), we can see the numbers are the same, which is not expected. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): 1.5.0 OS (e.g., Linux): Linux How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda Python version: 3.7.7 kornia: 0.3.2
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
I think the problem is <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kornia/kornia/blob/57f5aeb605d0c69de88a0a1aa1563cee52d4bfaf/kornia/augmentation/augmentation.py#L758>here</denchmark-link> . When you compute the target crop size, batch size is not taken as an input and one single crop size is returned, which will be used for every sample in the batch.
